{{cpp/title|isspace}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cctype|
int isspace( int ch );
}}

Checks if the given character is whitespace character as classified by the currently installed C locale. In the default locale, the whitespace characters are the following:

* space ({{tt|0x20}}, {{c|' '}})
* form feed ({{tt|0x0c}}, {{c|'\f'}})
* line feed ({{tt|0x0a}}, {{c|'\n'}})
* carriage return ({{tt|0x0d}}, {{c|'\r'}})
* horizontal tab ({{tt|0x09}}, {{c|'\t'}})
* vertical tab ({{tt|0x0b}}, {{c|'\v'}})

The behavior is undefined if the value of {{c|ch}} is not representable as {{c/core|unsigned char}} and is not equal to {{c|EOF}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character to classify}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Non-zero value if the character is a whitespace character, zero otherwise.

===Notes===
{{cpp/string/byte/note unsigned char}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cctype&gt;
#include &lt;climits&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
int main(void)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::setfill('0') &lt;&lt; std::uppercase;
    for (int ch{}; ch &lt;= UCHAR_MAX; ++ch)
        if (std::isspace(ch))
            std::cout &lt;&lt; std::setw(2) &lt;&lt; ch &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
09 0A 0B 0C 0D 20
}}
